request.description:
| **Method** | API endpoint |
| --- | --- |
| GET | localhost:8080/user/hangman/new |

The request return the flashcard sets of the user, with the flashcards in it. Then id of the flashcard set can be used in the POST request.

Here is a basic usage example using a POST request:

| **Method** | API endpoint | Content Type | Post Data |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| POST | localhost:8080/user/hangman/new | application/json | {set_id: 'id_of_your_flashcard_set', side: 'side_of_the_flashcard'} |

The request needs the following components:

1. end point – this should belocalhost:8080/user/hangman/new
2. set_id – the id of set of the flashcards. Id is Integer
3. side – the side of the flashcard you want to get your word off. If you have flashcards with one language on the front and another language on the back, and you want to select the side based on the convention chosen by the user, you can specify whether you want the "front" or "back" side when playing the hangman game. For example, if the user has chosen to store English words on the front side and Polish words on the back, and you select "front" as the side, the hangman game will use English words for the game.

Here is a basic usage example using a PUT request:

| **Method** | API endpoint | Content Type | Post Data |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| PUT | localhost:8080/user/hangman/guess/{gameID} | application/json | {guess: 'guessed_letter'} |

The request needs the following components:

1. end point – this should be localhost:8080/user/hangman/guess
2. guess – guessed letter. When repeatedly sending the same letter during the hangman game, two different behaviors can occur:
    1. If the letter is actually a part of the guessed word, it will be revealed in the appropriate positions of the word. Subsequent repeated sending of the same letter will have no effect on the game as the letter has already been correctly guessed and displayed.
    2. However, if the letter is not a part of the guessed word, sending it repeatedly will have negative consequences. The "guesses_left" counter will decrease with each incorrect guess, and ultimately, it may lead to losing the game if the counter reaches zero.

| **Method** | API endpoint |
| --- | --- |
| GET | localhost:8080/user/hangman/games/2 |

The request return the user's hangman game specified by its id in the url. User can only see his games, access to games of the other users is forbidden.

| **Method** | API endpoint |
| --- | --- |
| GET | localhost:8080/user/hangman/games/lost |

The request return the user's hangman games that have been lost.

| **Method** | API endpoint |
| --- | --- |
| GET | localhost:8080/user/hangman/games/active |

The request return the user's hangman games that are still active.

| **Method** | API endpoint |
| --- | --- |
| GET | localhost:8080/user/hangman/games/won |

The request return the user's hangman games that have been won.

This request returns a list of all the logged in user's sets and flashcards in them

| **Method** | API endpoint |
| --- | --- |
| GET | localhost:8080/user/flashcards/set |

The request needs the following components:

1. end point – this should be localhost:8080/user/flashcards/set

This request adds a new set with a given name | **Method** | API endpoint | Content Type | Post Data | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | POST | localhost:8080/user/flashcards/set | application/json | {"name":
"exampleSet"
} | The request needs the following components: 1. end point – this should be localhost:8080/user/flashcards/set 2. name – this should be the name of a newly created set

Here is a basic usage example using a PUT request: | **Method** | API endpoint | Content Type | Post Data | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | DELETE | localhost:8080/user/flashcards/set | application/json | {
"set_id": 13
} | The request needs the following components: 1. end point – this should be localhost:8080/user/flashcards/set 2. set_id – this should be the id of the set that needs to be removed

This request adds a flashcard to a set | **Method** | API endpoint | Content Type | Post Data | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | POST | localhost:8080/user/flashcards/set/flashcard | application/json | {
"set_id": 14,
"front": "kot",
"back": "cat"
} | The request needs the following components: 1. end point – this should be localhost:8080/user/flashcards/set/flashcard 2. set_id – the id of the set the flashcard is supposed to be added to 3. front – the front of the flashcard 4. back – the back of the flashcard Upon success a string "flashcard successfully added" is returned

This request changed the contents of a flashcard | **Method** | API endpoint | Content Type | Post Data | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | PUT | localhost:8080/user/flashcard/set/flashcard | application/json | {
"id": 27,
"front": "kotek",
"back": "kitty"
} | The request needs the following components: 1. end point – this should be localhost:8080/user/flashcard/set/flashcard 2. id – the id of the flashcard to be changed 3. front – optional parameter. if specified it changes the front side of the flashcard 4. back – optional parameter. if specified it changes the back side of the flashcard Upon success a string "flashcard changed" is returned

This request deletes the specified flashcard from a set | **Method** | API endpoint | Content Type | Post Data | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | DELETE | localhost:8080/user/flashcards/set/flashcard | application/json | {
"id": 27
} | The request needs the following components: 1. end point – this should be localhost:8080/user/flashcards/set/flashcard 2. id – the id of the flashcard to be deleted from a set
With this request, you can see your flashcard sets and each flashcard in those sets.

By using this request, you start a new game in Wordle.

You need to specify what set and what side of flashcards you want to use.

For example if you make all of your flashcards front side with foreign language words - you can use front to train them.

With this request as soon as you have active game, you can guess a word.

There's game_id needed and word you want to guess.

You can keep guessing and game will show you if any of last word letters are in word to guess.

response.name: incorrect
response.body:
{
    "gameID": 1,
    "status": "ACTIVE",
    "guess": "banana",
    "letterCount": 6,
    "guessesLeft": 5,
    "hint": [
        "b - GREY",
        "a - YELLOW",
        "n - GREY",
        "a - GREEN",
        "n - GREY",
        "a - YELLOW"
    ]
}

request.description: Get all won games in Wordle by specific user.

request.description: Get all active games in Wordle by specific user.
Get all lost games in Wordle by specific user.

Do you want to check how some games went?  

Just put the game_id on the end of the endpoint.

response.name: Game by ID
response.body:
{
    "gameID": 3,
    "status": "WON",
